utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: EPSIODE 3x23

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Illinois? That’s like five hundred miles from Manhattan. No, I know Northwestern is closer than Stanford. I’m just saying that’s not where you want to go.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hold on Ash, my dad’s talking to me. What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t you have school?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes. Look Ash, I know you and I think you need to get away from home. I mean, we all need to get away from home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I gotta go. We’ll talk about this later. Love you too. ‘Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We all need to get away from home?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, I should never leave. We can be the father daughter version of ‘Grey Gardens’.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ew. You look like you didn’t get any sleep.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I didn’t. I mean, Ashley got his college acceptances. He got in everywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh that’s great!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not great?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I looked up statistics for high school sweethearts when one of them goes to college out of state and the other stays in high school. The odds are not in our favor. I mean, I want him to go where he wants but I don’t want him to leave. And he doesn’t want to leave but I don’t want him to resent me for not going where he wants and … I don’t know what to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, do what I do. Look at the odds as a challenge.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Says the man who always loses in Vegas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Relationships are hard. Odds are you’ll figure it out.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Odds are someone’s dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve got to be kidding me. A murder in the theater of the V.B Tower Hotel? Victor Baron’s place? It’s not the Baron, is it?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But you won’t be disappointed. This one’s right up your alley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because our victim is a contestant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘Death of a Beauty Queen’. Scandalous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m surprised it doesn’t happen more often.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that America’s Dad, Bobby Stark? What’s he doing here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s a pageant host. Oh please, don’t tell me you watch his sitcom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Family Foibles? Half of what I know about being a father I learned from watching that show.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s the story?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, according to Candace Ford, our pageant manager, our victim is twenty one year old Amber Middleberry. The contestants were rehearsing the production number. When they brought in the lighting truss Amber was tangled up inside of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Must have been a show stopper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey there, Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Detective. Writer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause of death?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Choked from behind with her own sash. Probably between eleven PM and one AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did she end up on the lighting truss?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Near as we can tell the lighting truss was left onstage after yesterday’s rehearsal. Killer probably thought he’d buy some time by dumping her on it and raising it up to the rafters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whoever it was must have known how to use the stage equipment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, the lift controls, they’re on touch screen. Pretty easy to operate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was she last seen alive?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Last night. Contestants, they all went to a dinner to honor Victor Baron. Ten thirty the party wrapped and they were all limoed back here to the hotel. Amber used her key card at ten forty three PM to get into her hotel room. After that she wound up here.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Detective, there’s something you should see.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A black sequin?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Part of one. I found it in her hair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so the killer might have transferred it when he strangled her. Let’s find out who had access to this ballroom last night and let’s also talk to the pageant manager. I want to see if any of the girl’s outfits match with this sequin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Will do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So does Amber Middleberry have any family?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Just her … dad.

utterance.speaker: DAN
utterance.content: She started when she was nine. Little Miss Wholesome. I was against the idea at first but Amber’s mom had a bug about it and uh, right after her mother died … I think it just helped her feel closer to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did your daughter have any enemies you know of?

utterance.speaker: DAN
utterance.content: No, of course not. Everybody loved her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, what about the other contestants? Were there any rivalries?

utterance.speaker: DAN
utterance.content: She went way back with some of these girls. They … she … even after she made it to the semi-finals everybody was hugging her and they were calling her the front runner and … this pageant, this one, was her dream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you talked with her?

utterance.speaker: DAN
utterance.content: Yesterday morning. I tried to call her last night. I knew that dinner thing was over. I wanted to wish her luck, you know, but she didn’t answer the phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what time was that?

utterance.speaker: DAN
utterance.content: A little before eleven. I uh … I thought she must have gone to sleep but she must have left her room and come down here for some reason.

utterance.speaker: VICTOR BARON
utterance.content: Dan! I am so sorry. Gonna get the bastard that did this, you have my word.

utterance.speaker: DAN
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: Detective? A word upstairs, if you don’t mind.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: This is a dark day. A sad chapter in Baron’s All American Beauty Pagent.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA BARON
utterance.content: Victor, this is just awful.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: My wife, Kayla. You might recognize her as Baron’s All American Beauty 1995.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Nice to meet you, yes. This is just devastating. For us, and for the girls. We’re like family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How well did you know Amber?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: Um… she was a sweet girl. Hell of a violinist.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Yes, she was.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: Mark my words, I am putting the entire weight of the Baron empire behind this investigation. Anything you need, just say the word. Detective, I know you have to do your thing. I’m just hoping that since we’re airing the pageant live this Friday, if we could minimize the press, you know, to be fair to the other girls.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to have to be fair to our victim first. And speaking of press, can we get rid of the cameras? This is, after all, a murder investigation, not a reality show.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: We um, we film everything. The behind the scenes at the pageant. We like to catch the girls talking about each other. We let them confess their hopes and fears. You get the glamour but you also get the underbelly. People love the underbelly.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Yes, they do.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: But maybe this isn’t the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So were all the girls staying at the hotel?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll need access to Amber’s room. We’ll also need hotel security tapes. Now were those cameras recording last night’s dinner?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, we’ll need the footage. We’ll also need to interview all of the pageant contestants.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: I’ll have Candace give you anything you need.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Thank you very much. It was nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Come again. Oh no, we don’t –

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: We don’t want them to come again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Small town girl comes to New York for the fairy tale, ends up with a horror story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pageants aren’t fairy tales. They’re demanding, high pressure competitions that bring out the very best and the very worst in people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is the voice of experience. Oh my God, you were a beauty queen!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I had a roommate freshman year. Debbie Winaker. It was like living with Elle Woods on steroids.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, this ought to bring back some memories.

utterance.speaker: PAGEANT MOM
utterance.content: You’re slouching. Winners don’t slouch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, they’re everywhere!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It smells like a perfume counter at a department store.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It beats the usual lowlifes and nutjobs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know if you can say that nutjobs and beauty queens are mutually exclusive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but none of them connect to the murder. I checked the sequin against all their dresses –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet you did.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And none of them are a match.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, look at the footage from the dinner. Let’s make sure that the dresses we checked are the ones that they actually wore.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hum. Watch a parade of beautiful women in evening attire? Yeah, I can do that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet you can.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so, I’ve been interviewing these ladies –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet you did.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: About their alibis for last night. Anyway, there’s someone you should talk to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sascha, tell them what you told me.

utterance.speaker: SASCHA
utterance.content: When we got back to the hotel I wanted to work out a couple of my dance moves. I’m one of the semi finalists so I get to perform in the broadcast.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: SASCHA
utterance.content: Thanks. I’m doing an interpretive dance to J-Lo’s "I'm Into You".

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then what happened?

utterance.speaker: SASCHA
utterance.content: I changed into sweats and went to the stage and … that’s when I heard it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You heard what?

utterance.speaker: SASCHA
utterance.content: Uh … a fight? It was coming from the dressing room. It was Amber and some guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see the guy?

utterance.speaker: SASCHA
utterance.content: The door was closed. It started getting loud, so I bolted. But now I wish I had done something. I mean, maybe he’s the one who killed her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His voice. Did you recognize it?

utterance.speaker: SASCHA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What were they arguing about?

utterance.speaker: SASCHA
utterance.content: "How could you do this to me? You have no right. Who do you think you are?" Stuff like that. It kind of sounded like he was her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That was Amber’s dad. He said he didn’t know anything about a boyfriend. Neither did any of the other girls.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she was keeping it a secret.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They said if anyone knew what was going on in Amber’s life it was Justin Hankel, Amber’s pageant consultant.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN HANKEL
utterance.content: I coached her on her routine, interviews, oversaw stylists, makeup, clothing, violin lessons, glamour shots. Everything she needed to win.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The two of you must have spent a lot of time together.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: That’s what it takes. Today’s pageants are not just about beauty, they’re about brains, talent, social issues, and what with the money and the exposure at stake … winning one of the majors can launch a career.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about a boyfriend? Was she in a relationship?

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: No boyfriends. That is a rule for my clients and Amber was no exception. She knew that she needed to focus one hundred percent of her energy on the pageant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, the night that she died, she got into an argument. Any idea with whom?

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: No. The last time I saw her was before her dinner. But like I told that other detective, something was going on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: She’d been off the last couple of days. Upset. And I went to pick her up for a costume fitting and it looked like she

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you ask why?

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: She said that someone was trying to take advantage of her. I asked her who but she said she would handle it. It wasn’t like her not to confide in me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could it have been one of the other contestants?

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: There’s a lot of pressure on these girls to win. I mean, it can get really … political between them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you think it’s possible political turned deadly?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Winning means fame and fortune. No one remembers the runner up. Besides, people have killed for less.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That still doesn’t explain who she was arguing with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Guys? I got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One of the girls?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just watch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is from Baron’s dinner last night. That’s our victim, Amber. She’s laying it on thick for Victor Baron, but that’s not the interesting part. Now watch this. That. There. See that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at her face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like whatever good guy sitcom star Bobby Stark said, she didn’t like it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t just look at her face. Look at his tux.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Black sequins.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Bobby Stark’s blazer, courtesy of the costume lady at the pageant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the broken black sequin?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Perfect match.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bam, said the costume lady.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh … she’s not the only lady saying bam when it comes to Bobby Stark.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does he have a record?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, no criminal charges, but Mr. Stark has quite the reputation. Three women filed restraining orders against Bobby Stark in the last year. All for unwanted advances.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How come I didn’t hear about this on TMZ?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, word is Stark paid quite a bit of cash to make it all go away. Oh, it gets better. I was talking to Candace Ford and a couple of the other girls – they said that Bobby Stark had started paying quite a lot of attention to Amber.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it was unwanted attention.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe Bobby didn’t know how to take no for an answer.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: You lookin’ at me? Huh? You lookin’ at me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Stark, I’m Detective –

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: There’s nobody else around. You must be lookin’ at me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Stark?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have a seat, please.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Yeah. You like that bit? It’s my Bobby De Niro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Playing a homicidal maniac.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Sold it though, right? See, I got this range as an actor but you probably don’t know about that because I’m always typecast as mister-nice-guy dad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I don’t think you’ll have that problem now that you’re a murder suspect.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Murder suspect? Is she joking? Are you joking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was your relationship with Amber Middleberry?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon. I didn’t kill her. If anything I was trying to recruit her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Recruit her? For what?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: For my, uh, goddess train.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The goddess train?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s my own little private pageant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did Amber respond to this oh so enticing offer?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: You know what? She hadn’t seen the light yet. She was coming around. I could always tell the innocent act when I see it. Besides, who wouldn’t want to ride the Bobby Rocket?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everyone, from what we hear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Stark, here’s what I think happened. After dinner you invited Amber back to your dressing room and she had the bad sense to agree. And that’s when you decided to make another pitch to get her on board your goddess train.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When she shot you down, you flew into a rage and strangled her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were rehearsing on that stage all week. You knew all of the equipment.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Stop. Will you … just stop. You guys are crazy, you know that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay well, maybe you can explain why we found this broken sequin from your jacket on her body. Where were you between eleven and one AM last night?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Uh … I don’t know. I’m a little foggy on that, actually. I was … uh… partying pretty hard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who were you with?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Um … not sure, but whoever it was was definitely using strawberry oil.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so let me get this straight. You don’t remember where you were or what you were doing last night?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: That’s bad, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That guy’s dropped more pills than a three fingered pharmacist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just can’t believe that someone that’s given so much great fatherly advice on TV could be guilty of murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he’s a drug addled predator who left physical evidence on the body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, when you put it that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Esposito.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to reconstruct Stark’s evening. Check his phone records, double check security cameras at the hotel. We need hard evidence to place him at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I got something that might help. Amber had her violin with her at dinner, but it wasn’t with her body or anywhere at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So where did it go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we know Amber went to the hotel so maybe she dropped it off there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Except uniforms inventoried the room. It wasn’t there and her dad and consultant didn’t see it either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So maybe she had it when she was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Bobby Stark disposed of it. Check trash cans, dumpsters, and sewer drains around the hotel. If someone saw him ditch the violin we can connect him to the murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, beauty pageant intrigue. Some things never change. Ah, here it is!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahaha … I didn’t know you competed.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, that’s because I didn’t win.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: But I can tell you, the women I competed against? Just as cutthroat as they are now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was your talent?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: The way I wore a sweater.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Hey honey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Alexis. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ashley made his decision.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stanford?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. He decided to go to school here. In New York.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, what’s not good about that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Stanford was his dream. I don’t want to stand in the way of that. He’ll just end up hating me for it, and this could be the most important decision of his life, so I made a decision, too.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I broke up with him.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, baby. It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she’s right, you know. I mean, odds are it won’t work out. She’s just being practical.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Relationships aren’t math problems. You don’t solve them by being practical. I mean, what happens when she meets her soul mate and she doesn’t risk it because it’s not practical?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay then, what about Hawaii? Earrings? Oh! Lingerie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Things you buy a woman! Used to kill in Pyramid.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: It’s my thirtieth anniversary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh sir, congratulations.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thirty years of marriage and you don’t know what to buy her?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: If you stayed married long enough you’d know it’s hard to stay original after the first ten.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s fair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s the secret to your success?

utterance.speaker: MONTOMGERY
utterance.content: There’s no secret. Just keep … showing up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any luck on Bobby Stark?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but you’re not going to like it. Paparazzi snapped photos of him going into the Tribeca Grand Hotel at eleven thirty with a brunette wearing Jackie O glasses. At one AM he left, at which point he relocated to a gentleman’s club to watch mud wrestling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Amber left her room at eleven. Where was he between eleven and eleven thirty?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: In a cab, on his way to Tribeca.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And … we know this for a fact?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, he was tweeting photos of his manhood along the way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that’s how you trend on Twitter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the sequin must have broken off onto Amber after he bumped up against her. Cut him loose. He’s not our guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means we are dead in the water.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh… wouldn’t go that far. Her stolen violin? We found it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dumped in a garbage bin behind the hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Disposed of by our killer, just not we killer we thought.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did we get prints?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Amber Middleberry’s and one other set belonging to the lovely, the talented contestant from Georgia.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which one was … oh!

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: Amber and I have been friends since Little Miss Spangles. Why would you think I killed her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because your prints were all over the violin case, Joy. And she had it with her when she came back from dinner last night.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: I held it for her while she fixed her tights.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re on the violin, too.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: She wasn’t even supposed to be a semi-finalist. And then she nailed all her pageant questions. It was supposed to be her weakness, but she blew everyone away. She was going to win.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then you killed her and you dumped her violin.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: No! That is not what happened. Last night when we went back to the hotel I saw her go into her room, drop off her stuff, and then leave again. But she left so fast her door didn’t close all the way, so I went to shut it. That’s when I saw her violin. She just left it there. It was like a sign. I thought, ‘Joy Jones, how badly do you want this?’

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How … badly did you want it?

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: More than anything. I’m twenty five. I’m old. This is the last year I can qualify. I thought that if I took her violin it might throw her off enough in the talent finals that I could beat her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that wasn’t enough for you, was it? You thought, why not just take her out of the competition completely?

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: No! All I did was take her violin. When I found out she was dead, I panicked. I thought someone might find out so I threw it away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a pretty good act, Joy, but the judges just aren’t buying it.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: I swear! I didn’t have to kill Amber to get her out of that pageant. I found something in her violin case. Something awful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did you find?

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: The reason she was murdered.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: If these got out, it would have ruined her. She would have been kicked off the circuit for good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God. She is absolutely, totally -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Naked.

utterance.speaker: JOY
utterance.content: There’s a note on the back of that one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘You know my price. Pay up or I will destroy you.’ So she was being blackmailed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like somebody made good on their threat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beauty queens and naked pictures. It’s as American as socialites and sex tapes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Amber dreamt of winning this pageant. Why would she take those naked photos? I mean, she knew the chance she was taking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just because you’re smart and beautiful doesn’t mean you have good judgment. I didn’t mean me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just got off with Amber’s father. That was a tough conversation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean he didn’t know about the photos?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And Amber didn’t tell him about the blackmailer, either. Or try to borrow money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe she paid off the blackmailer on her own?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not an option. Any money Amber did have went to paying for shoes, gowns, and spray tans. She only had fifty bucks in the bank. And she didn’t have any recent withdraws, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Justin said she was upset. Maybe that’s because she didn’t have the money to make it go away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but then why kill her? A smart blackmailer would give her the time to get the cash.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not if she threatened to go to the police, forcing him to take deadly action. Deadly Action. That’s a good title.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I rechecked her phone. There’s no record of any unusual calls. I figure the blackmailer contacted her through the hotel phone - that way he couldn’t be traced.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, have you taken a look at these photos?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only insofar as it pertains to the investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at the lighting and the composition. Whoever took these knew something about photography.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A professional?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, it happens all the time. Girl gets a session with the pro, they finish, he offers to take a few art shots, she’s desperate for the cash, he promises he’ll never show it to anybody …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Until she makes it big, in which case they suddenly surface.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito, let’s get a hold of the pageant consultant. Let’s get a list of all the photographers that Amber’s had sessions with. One of them might be our blackmailer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: This must have been what she was so upset about. She knew that if the pageant found out, it would have all been over. It is all over. Why didn’t she just tell me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you have any idea who might have taken these photographs?

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: With that hairstyle, it must have been six months ago. I’ll have to check my calendar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So uniforms talked to the pageant girls that Amber was closest to. She didn’t tell them about the photos, either.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she probably thought they’d use it against her.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Beckett, you’re a woman, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I have no idea what to get your wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still no luck on the gift?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Keep coming up empty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The best thing to give a woman is something she said she wanted when she didn’t think you were listening.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What if I wasn’t listening?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gift certificate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So according to her pageant consultant, Amber was in the city six months ago for a photo shoot. He thinks they were taken about the same time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who was the shoot with?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A photographer named Dax Lattimer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does he have a record?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Negative. But I asked around and the guy is no stranger to dirty pictures. On top of headshots he also freelances for adult magazines.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, sounds like our guy. Where is he now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s got a studio in the East Village. I’m heading there now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll have Ryan meet you.

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: Yeah, I remember Amber. Very sweet gal. I took some headshots for her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You take anything else while you were at it? Maybe some snaps of her wearing nothing but a smile?

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: Amber wasn’t the type. She was all about the glamour. So what’s this about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She was murdered.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And we think whoever killed her took this picture right here.

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: Yeah well, I didn’t take this. I’m not that mediocre.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: These were shot around the time you worked with Amber. We all know you do more than just pets and families.

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: Hey, we all have to pay the bills.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And with Amber’s star on the rise, that photo is worth some serious coin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pretty girl like that? Alone here in the studio …

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: Hey, you have to believe me. I didn’t take this photograph. Besides, we weren’t alone. She was with someone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: Some boyfriend. Guy was a real creep, too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Amber didn’t have a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: Well, she did when she was here. In fact, he fancied himself a photographer. Kept telling me I should shoot Amber in natural light.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This boyfriend have a name?

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: Jerry … Jeremy… something like that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Lattimer, where were you the night before last between eleven PM and one AM?

utterance.speaker: LATTIMER
utterance.content: At home with my wife. Trying to rock my colicky son to sleep. It’s a doorman building, so you can check.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thanks. Amber’s dad said she used to have a boyfriend. Jeremy Keiper.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Keiper? Was he creepy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, her dad thought so. As far as he knows, they broke up late last year because she realized he was holding her back. The dad thinks that the boyfriend is still in Illinois.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s the beauty of blackmail. You can do it from anywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Blackmail maybe, but not murder. Why don’t we find out if Keiper paid her a visit lately.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bad boyfriends and pageant queens? This is like Debbie Winaker all over again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You having flashbacks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was my own private Vietnam. Our place smelled of hairspray, perfume, and cigarettes. I’m surprised that we didn’t spontaneously combust.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love the smell of hairspray in the morning. It smells like … victory.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Excuse me, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ashley?

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: I’m sorry to bug you at work, but Alexis established a no calls, no contact policy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She told me.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Look, I made a big mistake. I thought if I chose Stanford Alexis would think that I was blowing her off. Instead she’s mad at me because I chose her over where I want to go to school. So now I’m going to Stanford, which is where I wanted to go in the first place, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if you call her and tell her that, she’ll be even angrier with you for ignoring her boundaries.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Exactly! Look, I think Alexis and I can make the whole long distance thing work, I really do. Would you tell her that? Would you talk to her for me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ashley, I appreciate that it was probably very hard for you to come down and talk to me today, but … I just don’t think it’s very appropriate for me to –

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, have you ever been crazy about someone who is determined to push you away?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Castle – oh, sorry guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No … uh … It’s okay. Um… Ashley, I’m sorry, I do have to go.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Please just … think about it, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was that about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wants me to advocate for him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Well, that’s sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And awkward.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mostly awkward.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yo Beckett! Just got off the phone with Jeremy Keiper’s mom. Turns out, Jeremy moved to New York last month. Said he was going to make something of himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like he made himself into a blackmailer and a killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jeremy Keiper! NYPD! Open up!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Keiper? Anyone here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like someone had a hard time letting go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is a classic murder suicide. Jeremy blackmails his ex-girlfriend, not because he needs the money but because clearly, he’s obsessed with her. Amber rejects him and his sleazy schemes and he flips. He snaps and kills her and then, faced with the reality of what he’s done, hangs himself.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Only one problem with your theory, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: This wasn’t a suicide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This wasn’t?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: If he had hanged himself the marks on his neck would angle upwards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which they do.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Yes! But if he was strangled the marks would go straight across. This guy’s got both.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the hanging was a cover-up for the strangulation.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well, there’s also perimortem bruising on the arms and across the ribs. I’m guessing there was a struggle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Estimated time of death?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Ah, judging by temperature and lividity he was killed half a day before Amber Middleberry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Before Amber?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Yes! Before! Now can you please move? You’re in my light.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, this doesn’t make any sense. If he didn’t kill Amber – How do a blackmailer and his victim both end up dead?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, check this out. His hard drive’s been wiped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s our connection, Castle. It’s the one thing that Amber and Jeremy had in common – those photos. Someone didn’t want them to see the light of day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Amber’s dad had no idea this was going on with his daughter. She didn’t even mention Jeremy’s name in the last six months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is there anything else Jeremy and Amber could have been involved in while there were together?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, not that he can recall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These pictures, by today’s standards, are downright tasteful. How do these get you killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It can’t be about naked pictures. Something else must have been going on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless Jeremy wasn’t the only blackmailer. What if he had a partner? I mean, we know Amber was arguing with someone the night she was killed. We know It couldn’t have been Jeremy because he was already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would the partner kill Jeremy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe they had a falling out. Maybe Jeremy decided he couldn’t hurt Amber, but the partner still wanted his payday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he takes out Jeremy and decides to go after Amber himself?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Amber decides to call his bluff. She says she’s going to contact the police. Now the blackmailer has no choice. He has to kill her and get rid of all the evidence of blackmail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan? Get me everything you got on Jeremy Keiper.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry, baby.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s late. I’ll see you two later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’cha looking at?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really miss him, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know I hate to interfere –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Point taken. … Ashley dropped by the precinct to see me today.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He did? Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wanted me to intercede on his behalf.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he looked about as happy as you do. And he wanted me to tell you that he’s decided to go to Stanford.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And, he wants to give a long distance relationship a shot. He thinks it could work.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think that nothing is certain. And you could be ending something that could have worked, if you had just given it a little more time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What if I’m just cutting my losses on something that was never meant to be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, we can be the father daughter version of 'Grey Gardens'. But life is a journey and there is no predicting the outcome. Only thing you can control are your choices and know that they’ll define who you are. I would just hate to see you so focused on the problem right in front of you that you completely miss the entire picture.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s pretty good advice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, actually it is, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Remind me to get you a subscription to a girly magazine for Christmas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that is so thoughtful. But I’m not looking at the naked girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you looking at?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everything but the naked girl. We were so focused on Amber, we almost missed the entire picture. What if Amber and Jeremy were killed, not because of who was in this photo, but because of where this photo was taken? Anything look familiar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can thank me later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Talk about a motive for murder, if these photos got out to the tabloids…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’d destroy everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: PAGEANT COORDINATOR
utterance.content: They’re inside.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: The memorial for Amber should be simple. Peaceful.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: And very, very classy.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: Detective! Is there something I can help you with?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, we need to ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: Ask away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. Tell us about the blackmail and the murder of Amber MIddleberry.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: Shut the cameras off! Go! Now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought you said that everybody loves the underbelly.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: This … this …

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: What’s going on, Victor?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s going on is we finally figured out who, aside from Amber, would be nervous about these photos.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: What photos? Oh my God! Oh my God, Victor! Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: It’s not what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: It’s not what it looks like? This is … … this is our house in the Hamptons. This is our bed.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: It’s our vacation bed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right underneath the two million dollar Picard that you purchased at the auction, which happens to be the companion to this painting here in your office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We read all about it in the spread they did on you in Today’s Architect. Looks as though you were hoisted on your own Picard.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: I can explain.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: We agreed, Victor. Never again.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: It was just the weekend.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Just a weekend? I have friends in the Hamptons. What if somebody saw? I won’t be humiliated because you can’t keep it in your pants.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: No one saw!

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: No one saw? No, you took photos so everyone could see!

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: I didn’t take those pictures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s what I think happened. Amber was being blackmailed, she couldn’t pay, so she came to you for help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only you had a lot to lose. Those pictures, they have a way of getting out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So instead of paying off her blackmailer, you killed him. And you came back here and took care of her.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: It’s not what happened!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The cameras aren’t rolling anymore, Mr. Baron. You can drop the act.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: It’s not an act. Amber wasn’t being blackmailed. The conniving ***** was blackmailing me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was blackmailing you?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: She showed me the pictures. She said she had her boyfriend come and take them while I was away.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Wait, you left her alone in my house?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: I had a meeting in the city. I was coming right back.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: How could you be so stupid, Victor?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: She said that If I helped her win the pageant the photos would never see the light of day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "You know the price, pay up or I’ll destroy you." It wasn’t to Amber, it was from Amber. She was still with her boyfriend. They were in it together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then what did you do?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: I slipped her the pageant questions. Why do you think she was doing so well?

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: You ass!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh! Hey! Hey! Mr. Baron, where were you between eleven and one AM the night of the murder?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: After the reception I had drinks with Councilman Bollinger, uh … I got home at one AM. Kayla was with me. Weren’t you, babe?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kayla? Is this true? Were you with him?

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Yes. Who else knew, Victor? Who do I need to be ashamed in front of?

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: No one else knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, someone else must have, otherwise two people wouldn’t be dead.

utterance.speaker: BARON
utterance.content: The only other person I told was Candace. I told her what Amber was trying to do, to me, to the pageant. I … I told her to take care of it, make the problem go away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe she did.

utterance.speaker: CANDACE
utterance.content: I don’t want to see any fingerprints on those glasses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Being careful of fingerprints, are we Candace?

utterance.speaker: CANDACE
utterance.content: We want everything to be perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This pageant really is your baby.

utterance.speaker: CANDACE
utterance.content: You noticed? Seventeen flawless years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then you would do anything to protect it. We know that Mr. Baron told you about the blackmail. And we know he asked you to handle it.

utterance.speaker: CANDACE
utterance.content: Kill her? I wanted to kill Baron. Seventeen flawless years and he wants me to give her the answers so his little fling can wear the crown? But it was either that or that snake destroys everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you the night Amber was killed?

utterance.speaker: CANDACE
utterance.content: Please don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Ford –

utterance.speaker: CANDACE
utterance.content: I was with someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: CANDACE
utterance.content: I can’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Candace, if you have an alibi –

utterance.speaker: CANDACE
utterance.content: Bobby Stark. I was with him at the Tribeca Grand. And the worst part is he doesn’t even remember.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tribeca Grand confirms that Stark was with Candace at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She did smell a little bit like strawberry oil.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Baron’s alibi checks out, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which leaves us without a suspect. Okay, get into it with Baron’s lawyers. Just because Candace didn’t kill them doesn’t mean he didn’t hire someone else to do it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Blind naked ambition. I think even your Debbie Winaker would be appalled.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, she would’ve. Debbie wanted to be a beauty queen because she believed in the ideals of beauty. She wanted to be beautiful on the inside and outside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you didn’t like her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, deep down, behind all the makeup and the hair, she wasn’t terrible. She was just a miserable person to live with. Unlike Amber, winning wouldn’t have meant a thing to her if she had to cheat to do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, talk about choices that change your life. When do you make that choice? When does winning become more important than your soul?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. You have to be pretty cold and calculating to make some of the choices Amber did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cold and calculating.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Amber was cold and calculating.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … all of those people we talked to about her? One of them was lying.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: Tragedy struck the Baron’s All American Pageant with the untimely passing of our Illinois All American, Miss Amber Middleberry. I was fortunate to work closely with Amber. She meant the world to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, why did you kill her?

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: What? I didn’t kill Amber.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re lying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve been lying to us the whole time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You told us that she was upset that she was feeling like she was being taken advantage of and threatened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But she was the one doing the threatening. There was no reason for her to be upset.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: You know, you’re interrupting a dress rehearsal. I don’t even know what you two are talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yes you do. You got on to the blackmail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You thought the old boyfriend was taking advantage of your prized client, so you confronted him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We ran your credit cards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know about the cab ride you took to Jeremy’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So tell us, when you killed Amber’s boyfriend, did you know Amber was in on the scheme?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Justin. Justin, stop!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A word of advice, Justin? When the lady says stop, stop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Justin confessed to everything. His last three clients were losers. Amber was supposed to be his comeback and if she didn’t win he was through. And apparently he found the same naked photos that we did and thought that her ex-boyfriend was trying to exploit her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was worried if they called the cops that their secret would get out and they would be ruined, so he decided to handle it on his own. Unfortunately Jeremy was drunk, he got violent, and Justin ended up killing him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he staged it like it was a suicide. Once Amber found out she threatened to turn him in and he killed her.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That’s a whole pageant of bad choices. Good work, you two. Uh, good work, you all.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… I see a beauty queen worthy of a crown.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Always the charmer, Rick.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Hey, what’cha doing here? You know I was just coming to swoop you up.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: Yeah well, I know how you lose all sense of time when you’re working. I figured I’d meet you here.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you guys have any big plans?

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: Dinner and dancing with the best husband in Manhattan. Especially since he gave me that gift this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, what did you end up giving her?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I followed your advice, Castle. I thought about some of the things Evelyn said she wanted the past couple of years. And my gift to her is - next year I’m retiring from the force.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: We’re going to go traveling. We’re going to go to all of the romantic places.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, are you serious, boss?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You really want to retire?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I haven’t accomplished everything I want to on the job, but I’ve done enough. It’s time for me to move on.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: Best gift ever. More Roy.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Look, I’ve taught you guys everything I know about doing this job, all right? You’re going to be fine without me. For crying out loud, lose the long faces. Smile, please. That’s an order.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You kids take care, all right? You guys behave now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Have a good time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Congratulations, you guys. Good night.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Night.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: ‘Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Happy anniversary.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Goodnight, Captain.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What the hell did you say to him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. No, I just told him to listen to what his wife wanted.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Damn Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you … I didn’t… there’s no way …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, let me let you in on a little secret. Captain Montgomery retires all the time, just give it a week or two. He’s like the Brett Favre of the NYPD. Trust me. He’s not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey so, I’ve been meaning to ask you. Did Alexis make a decision about Ashley?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, she did, actually. She decided it was worth the risk and she’s going to just keep showing up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a good choice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ashley! What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Hey, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad. Guess what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m going to Stanford.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m applying for early admission. And since I’ve been taking extra classes each semester since my freshman year, I have enough credits to graduate in the fall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. This way Ash and I will be together in January. In college.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: That was actually her idea, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
